definition:
An [*arrow*]{} is a line, usually straight, capped at one end, or both
ends, with an arrowhead which points in a specific direction. In a
flowchart, arrows show the order in which instructions are to be
performed (including where branching may occur) or they show the flow of
cause and effect. In certain arrangements of numbers, such as the
Collatz tree, arrows show which numbers are the input values, with the
output value being pointed at by the arrowhead.

In writing about vectors, arrows can be written over the symbols for the
origin and the endpoint, e.g., $\overrightarrow{AB}$ and
$\overleftarrow{CD}$. TeX provides commands for these.

An arrow, regarded as a morphism, functor or natural transformation also
plays central roles in Category Theory and Categorical Dynamics.
